data.title: MOVIES FEATURED ON LIFETIME
data.meta_description: LIFETIME ORIGINAL MOVIES/MINI-SERIES | MOVIES BASED ON TRUE STORIES
data.text:
Who could have stabbed popular, beautiful cheerleader Stacy to death? It could have been antisocial Goth girl Monica, it could've been angst-ridden Jill--or maybe it was the plain girl nobody suspected.

Two childhood friends grow up. One has a family and the other has a career. One relationship may make or break a family. Paul, the teenage son, must decide what he wants for his future. While family would like to make that decision for him. Watch as all the truth unravels in this drama/ romance

After the shocking murder of her mother, a girl helps a police detective by searching her home for clues that they hope will lead to the perpetrator.

A girl finds herself shamed in her small rural town after being raped by a football player. Her boyfriend, her mother and her lawyer all try their best to protect her, but will the local high school put a stop to the harassment?

Halifax is hit with an outbreak of STDs among high-school students. Among them is Hannah Vogel, and her horrified mother tries to find out why this is happening.

Beautiful Katie Lapp has always felt something missing in her simple Amish existence -- until a mysterious "Englisher" comes to Lancaster County looking for the baby girl she gave up for adoption 19 years ago.

Fact-based made-for-TV movie about Laurie Kellogg, who was accused of murdering her husband Bruce in May 1992; told in flashbacks while she's waiting for her judgment. When she was 16, Laurie met Bruce Kellogg, a charming guy 15 years her senior, and soon afterward she moved in with him, unaware that he had "bought" her from her stepfather for $500. At first, the relationship goes well, but Bruce soon shows his real self and the naive young bride's life spins out of control.

Diane and David love each other, but when they go to separate army academies, David has an affair. Diane snaps and ultimately something very sinister happens that the couple get involved in.

Several of the McAdams' neighbors are victims of a series of burglaries. One evening, their house is tragically hit, too: Mr. McAdams finds his wife dead in the bathroom, his 16-year-old daughter Aimee unconscious at the base of the stairs. She's in a coma for 18 months; when she wakes up, she can't remember anything from that fatal evening. But during her physical recovery she relives the happenings in her dreams more and more clearly. She becomes afraid that she might get a target of that murderer too.

A girl is beaten and raped by someone from her school; when lack of proof keeps him from prison, the girl's mother sets out to reveal the truth.
